div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h1.style: text-align: center; font-style: italic; font-family: open sans, arial, sans serif; font-size: 5em; font-weight: 300;

div.style: text-align: center; font-style: italic; font-family: open sans, arial, sans serif; margin-bottom: 3%;
div.p:
As promised, North East ISD wants to make sure you have up-to-date information when it comes to the coronavirus (COVID-19) and its impact on our District.
Due to Governor Greg Abbott’s executive order, North East ISD schools will stay closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: NEISD schools closed for remainder of academic year

a.span: NEISD schools closed for remainder of academic year

div.p: Due to Governor Greg Abbott’s executive order, North East ISD schools will stay closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. Distance learning and meal distribution will continue as scheduled.

a.title: Go to comments for NEISD schools closed for remainder of academic year

img.alt: San Antonio needs you to help stop the spread of COVID-19

a.span: San Antonio needs you to help stop the spread of COVID-19

div.p: Click here to learn more about the health and safety resources that are available to you

a.title: Go to comments for San Antonio needs you to help stop the spread of COVID-19

div.p: The NEISD School Nurse Hotline connects parents with a nurse who can help answer questions and offer guidance on weekdays from 8 a.m. – 3:30 p.m. Dial 210-407-0593 to speak with a school nurse.

a.title: Go to comments for #NEISDcares | District launches School Nurse Hotline

img.alt: NEISD adjusts meal distribution schedule; same number of meals being served

a.span: NEISD adjusts meal distribution schedule; same number of meals being served

div.p: Starting Monday, April 13, North East ISD will adjust its meal distribution services to Mondays and Thursday from 11:30 a.m. – 1:30 p.m. at the same campus locations. This change is an effort to reduce exposure for our employees and community members by limiting daily contact. The same number of meals will be distributed.

a.title: Go to comments for NEISD adjusts meal distribution schedule; same number of meals being served

div.p: Beginning Monday, March 23, the District will have phone lines available for counseling questions or concerns. Counselors will work on a rotating basis to answer the support lines weekdays from 8:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m.

a.title: Go to comments for NEISD launches Counselor Support Lines

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.div: What is Coronavirus? Coronaviruses have been around for decades and are perhaps best known for causing illnesses like the common cold, with symptoms like coughing, sneezing and other upper respiratory issues. In late 2019, a new coronavirus was discovered. Please visit the CDC website for accurate, up-to-date information and recommendations about COVID-19 and influenza.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: As North East ISD continues to monitor the impact of coronavirus (COVID-19), we know there are a lot of questions surrounding this respiratory illness. The District wants to keep our parents and community informed as we work closely with local health officials and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC).
NEISD Health Services has created a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document to help answer questions you may have. We will update the FAQ as needed.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h1.aria-label: When should I keep my child home from school?
h1.span: When should I keep my child home from school?

p.span: Students should stay home from school when exhibiting signs or symptoms of an illness, including fever and cough. At this time, we are continuing to follow the communicable disease exclusion criteria currently in place (Texas Education Code Rule § 97.7). Students with a fever (100.0° F or greater) will be sent home from school and may return once fever free for 24 hours, without the use of fever-reducing medication. Additional information may be found in the Student/Parent Handbook. If your child is ill and in need of medical attention, please contact your healthcare provider.

h1.aria-label: What cleaning is being done routinely?
h1.span: What cleaning is being done routinely?

p.span: Custodial staff are disinfecting all high-touch areas daily (desks, light switches, doorknobs, water fountains, etc.) with chemical disinfectant applied by hand. The chemical disinfectant is a hydrogen peroxide-based solution. Custodial teams are also prepared with electrostatic decontamination applicators that create a microbial barrier around surfaces that can last up to 90 days.

h1.aria-label: Should I send my child to school wearing a mask?
h1.span: Should I send my child to school wearing a mask?

p.span: The CDC is recommending people who are well not wear masks. If someone is ill and needs to be around others, the ill person may consider wearing a mask to prevent spreading their germs. If a parent/guardian chooses to have their child wear a mask to school, the student will be allowed to wear the mask. The school will not supply masks or replace a mask if it becomes soiled or torn. Students will be responsible for the management of their own masks if brought to school. Parents/guardians may not request other students to wear masks. Parents/guardians may not supply masks for other students’ use. There may come a time when school nurses will place a mask on a student exhibiting symptoms of communicable illness while they wait to be picked up from school.

h1.aria-label: How are schools monitoring for Coronavirus?
h1.span: How are schools monitoring for Coronavirus?

p.span: School nurses document all clinic visits, including the presence of any symptoms of communicable illness. Each year this information is used to track and respond appropriately during cold and flu season. San Antonio Metropolitan Health District (SAMHD) has guidelines in place requiring the reporting of certain health conditions or symptoms. Health Services monitors this clinic visit information and shares pertinent data with SAMHD, including any identified trends, which may be helpful in the early identification and/or prevention of communicable illness. Additionally, school absence rates are monitored and used by SAMHD to make recommendations.

h1.aria-label: What preventative measures are being taken?
h1.span: What preventative measures are being taken?

div.p: As a school district, we are prepared to discuss measures to prevent the spread of illness. Many of these actions are discussed and reinforced routinely to prevent or slow the spread of common illnesses, such as the common cold. The following methods are supported by SAMHD and CDC recommendations.

ul.li: Communication with parents/guardians as new information becomes available
Providing alcohol-based hand sanitizer in all district locations
Hand-washing posters are being placed in all restrooms
Hand-washing reminders are being given daily during morning announcements
Communicable illness prevention posters are being placed at all district locations
Frequent, routine checking of soap and hand sanitizer dispensers in each district location to ensure hand-washing supplies remain available
Instructing students and staff to remain home when sick
Instruction and encouragement to cover cough/sneeze, avoid touching eyes/nose/mouth, and wash hands frequently

h1.aria-label: What if someone exhibits symptoms while at school?
h1.span: What if someone exhibits symptoms while at school?

div.p: School nurses document all clinic visits, including the presence of any symptoms of communicable illness. Each year this information is used to track and respond appropriately during cold and flu season. San Antonio Metropolitan Health District (SAMHD) has guidelines in place requiring the reporting of certain health conditions or symptoms. Health Services monitors this clinic visit information and shares pertinent data with SAMHD, including any identified trends, which may be helpful in the early identification and/or prevention of communicable illness. Additionally, school absence rates are monitored and used by SAMHD to make recommendations.

h1.aria-label: How do I know if my child’s school has hand sanitizer available?
h1.span: How do I know if my child’s school has hand sanitizer available?

p.span: Currently all wall-mounted hand sanitizer dispensers in NEISD have been filled and contain alcohol-based hand sanitizer, which meets the alcohol concentration recommendations of the CDC. Custodial staff are routinely checking both hand sanitizer and soap dispensers to ensure supplies are available for frequent hand-washing.

div.p: Students can continue learning from home!

div.style: padding: 30px; text-align: center; background-color: #EC6544; color: #ffffff; margin-top: 10%;

p.strong:
Viewing this information requires you to login with your District credentials.
To reset your password use the Reset Password button below or contact the Help Desk M-F (7:30am-4:00pm) at 210-356-HELP. You can also submit an online help desk ticket.

div.p: In accordance with Title VI-Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX-Education Amendment of 1972, Section 504-Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and Title II of the American with Disabilities Act of 1992, the North East Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, sex or handicap.

EL Distrito Escolar Independiente de North East no discrimina por motivos de edad, raza, religión, color, origen nacional, sexo, estado civil o condición de veterano, impedimento (o relación o asociación con algún individuo con una discapacidad), información genética o algún otro estado legalmente protegido en sus programas, servicios o actividades vocacionales, tal como lo requiere el Titulo VI de la Ley de Derechos Civiles de 1964, en su versión modificada; el Titulo IX de las Enmiendas de Educación, de 1972, y la Sección 504 de la Ley de Rehabilitación de 1973, en su versión modificada.
